name: Shifter Question:  How do we compute shifted AB?
author: Roxiee

posts.author: Roxiee
posts.content:
I'm not sure where to get the AB for shifted forms.  I've searched our game guides but I can't find if the un-shifted AB has any effect on the shifted one.

I've seen articles about the item merges, and I'm assuming that if I find a +10 weapon, that +10 will be counted towards the AB.  But the base AB or attack schedule, how do I compute it for the different shapes?

Thanks!

posts.author: Yunim
posts.content:
The same way you compute AB for non-shifters, BAB + STR/DEX + Feats + Effects + Size Modifier.
Bear in mind that for unarmed shifter forms only Epic Prowess gives AB (no WF/EWF: Unarmed) and that AB from weapons won't merge in vanilla NWN.

posts.author: Yunim
posts.content:
The BAB refers to your specific character's Base Attack Bonus, that will vary depending on the build. The "BAB + x" written on the wiki is effectively factoring in STR/DEX and AB from weapons, it might be confusing to read.

eg: epic kobold commando / BAB +14
The +14 comes from +7 (DEX) +6 (Weapon) +1 (Size) = +14.
It doesn't mean that your BAB is 14.

If you want your full AB it's best to calculate it completely, that way you won't get confused.
So AB = BAB (depends on your build) + 7 (DEX) + 4 (Feats) + 6 (Weapon AB) + 1 (Size) = BAB +18.
Assuming that your BAB is 25 at level 40, that's an AB of +43 at level 40. With +11 DEX you could reach +49 AB when fully buffed.

I guess a Shifter can still at least keep up at those levels, but I would assume it gets left behind starting mid-epic levels.  I think I can live with that.

posts.author: Stagmeister
posts.content:
One of the problems with going for both kobold and Risen Lord shapes is which stats get overwritten. With kobold it's DEX, so you can pile your stat bumps into STR, whereas with Risen Lord it's STR, so you'd want to boost DEX. With both, you either find yourself not excelling in either shape or you excel in one at the expense of the other. It can all get very confusing!

Here are a couple of links which highlight what I mean:
Yip Yip, You're Dead
Lord of Terror
Cheers
